snippet: The review of police actions appears to be part of a deeper critical look at Bo Xilai’s four-year reign in Chongqing.
abstract: Police officers in Chongqing, China, are being investigated over whether they used torture and other questionable methods to obtain evidence during an anti-crime campaign overseen by Bo Xilai, the deposed Chinese leader; review appears to be part of a deeper critical look by Communist Party officials at Bo's four-year reign in the city and could be used to further tarnish his reputation.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing, and Shi Da contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The review of police actions appears to be part of a deeper critical look at Bo Xilai’s four-year reign in Chongqing.
